investigationEvent.text:
An initial literature report was received on 24-Feb-2020, from an author by Bells Healthcare.
This is case of 64-year-old-adult female patient who took accidental overdose (PT: Accidental overdose) of company suspect paracetamol (unknown dose, route and frequency) for unknown indication and experienced renal failure (PT: Renal failure), pulmonary failure (PT: Respiratory failure), sepsis (PT: Sepsis). Other co-suspect drugs were not reported.
The other relevant medical history and concomitant drugs were not reported.
On an unknown date, the patient received accidental overdose of paracetamol (dose, frequency and route of administration unknown) for an unknown indication. After an unspecified duration, the patient was admitted due to renal failure, pulmonary failure and sepsis. At the time of scanning the patient was sedated and intubated. The patient was scanned in a semi-recumbent position in bed, with eyelids held open by one of the scan operators. Additional technical challenges were the poor quality of the ocular surface due to poor lid closure and inadequate lubrication resulting in corneal epitheliopathy (exposure keratopathy) and patient movement resulting in an alignment artefact in the reconstructed Optical coherence tomography angiography (OCTA) rendition of the capillary plexi.
Action taken with company suspect drug was unknown.
The outcome of the events was unknown.
The events were assessed as serious (Life Threatening and Hospitalization).
Author's comment:
Authors reported that, the patient had secondary renal failure, pulmonary failure and sepsis after receiving accidental overdose of paracetamol.
Citation:
Liu X, Kale AU, Capewell N, Talbot N, Ahmed S, Keane PA, et al. Optical coherence tomography (OCT) in unconscious and systemically unwell patients using a mobile OCT device: A pilot study. BMJ Open. 2019; 9:11; e030882. On an unknown date: Optical coherence tomography shows, poor ocular surface and an alignment artefact arising from patient movement.

document.bibliographicDesignationText: Liu X, Kale AU, Capewell N, Talbot N, Ahmed S, Keane PA, et al.. Optical coherence tomography (OCT) in unconscious and systemically unwell patients using a mobile OCT device: A pilot study.. BMJ Open. 2019;9:11:e030882.

observationEvent.value: The case was assessed as medically confirmed, serious and unexpected as per paracetamol SmPc. The events accidental overdose (PT: Accidental overdose), pulmonary failure (PT: Respiratory failure), sepsis (PT: Sepsis) and secondary renal failure (PT: Renal failure) were assessed as serious and unexpected as per paracetamol SmPc. Based on the reported information, the role of paracetamol cannot be ruled out in terms of temporal relationship and its known safety profile.

The case was assessed as medically confirmed, serious and unexpected as per paracetamol SmPc. The events accidental overdose (PT: Accidental overdose), pulmonary failure (PT: Respiratory failure), sepsis (PT: Sepsis) and secondary renal failure (PT: Renal failure) were assessed as serious and unexpected as per paracetamol SmPc. Based on the reported information, the role of paracetamol cannot be ruled out in terms of temporal relationship and its known safety profile.
